thread.title: The Devon towns leading the new business boom | Devon Live
thread.title_full: The Devon towns leading the new business boom | Devon Live

title: The Devon towns leading the new business boom | Devon Live
text:
The Devon towns leading the new business boom By HannahFinch | Posted: March 02, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES There were 882 businesses formed in Exeter last year The Devon towns leading the new business boom X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Plymouth, Exeter and Torbay lead the way for start-up business in Devon. New figures compiled by Inform Direct show that more new companies were registered in Devon during 2016 than in any previous year.Plymouth formed the most new businesses (1,189), followed by Exeter (882) and Torbay (778). 
A total of 5,703 new businesses were established in the county compared to 5,394 in 2015.In Cornwall, 2,468 businesses were formed during 2016 resulting in 4.2% more companies in Cornwall compared to 2015. 
Inform Direct Infographic - Company formations in Devon 2016 
The statistics come from the Inform Direct Review of UK Company Formations, using data from Companies House and the Office of National Statistics. 
John Korchak, Director of Operations at Inform Direct said: "These figures underline the positive entrepreneurial culture that fosters new company formations and drives economic growth. So far, at least, we're not seeing evidence that the Brexit vote has dented confidence among those considering starting up in business. "Devon again delivered an impressive number of new companies in 2016 – more than in any year to date – demonstrating that it offers a fertile environment for new businesses to spring up and prosper."
